title: Strictly's Tess Daly stuns in figure-hugging velvet dress on Sunday results show

Tess Daly left fans in awe with her stunning outfit for Strictly Come Dancing ’s Sunday results show.

The 50-year-old star wowed fans in a black velvet midi dress with long puffy sleeves and figure-flattering runching along the front.

The simple outfit, available to buy from lORANE for £510, was completed with scrappy nude heels and simple jewellery.

Tess opted to keep her blonde hair in loose curls pulled back into a low ponytail, with the style perfect for showing off the square neckline of her dress.

(Image: Tess Daly/Instagram)

Complementing the glam look, Tess wore gold eyeshadow, thick black mascara and a sweep of blusher along her cheeks for a soft glow.

The stunning Strictly host took to Instagram to thank her glam squad, writing: “Results show time @bbcstrictly… Did you SEE the opening number by our amazing professional dancers? Incredible!! … Big thanks to my fab @aimeeadamsmakeup @adamreedhair @jamesyardley for getting me show ready … #glamfam #strictly #movienight”.

(Image: Tess Daly/Instagram)

(Image: Tess Daly/Instagram)

Fans immediately rushed to praise her look, describing the star as "stunning" and "sensational".

Co-host Claudia Winkleman looked equally glamorous in a sparkling dark grey dress, complete with thigh-high split.

The dress costs £290 and is available to purchase from Maje.

She left her trademark thick hair down in loose waves, and opted for a pair of white Christian Louboutin heels in white.

The hosts’ glamorous looks kept in line with this week’s Strictly theme of movies, with both oozing Hollywood chic.

Despite presenting as a united front, both presenters have their own personal stylists to ensure their looks suit their individual personalities.

Stylist Sinead McKeefry has taken charge of Claudia’s Strictly wardrobe, consisting of a number of all-black ensembles, sparkles and occasional pops of colour.

Co-host Tess prefers a more feminine look, which is put together by her stylist James Yardley.
